issues.description: The problem statement and UML specify Milkable.messageOnMilk() as returning a String (the method should return a message like "[Animal Type] [name] is milked"). However, the solution repository declares Milkable.messageOnMilk() with return type boolean, and the Seal and Goat implementations print the milk message to stdout and return true. This contradicts the specified return type and expected behavior, and will confuse students about the correct method signature and what to implement/return.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the interface and implementations with the problem specification: change Milkable.messageOnMilk() to return String (signature: String messageOnMilk()). Update Goat and Seal to return the message string (e.g. return getClass().getSimpleName() + " " + getName() + " is milked";) instead of printing and returning a boolean. This preserves the educational intent (methods returning messages) and matches the UML and textual instructions.
